definition.definition: an amount of something that you are allowed
definition.example: The baggage/luggage allowance for most flights is 20 kilos.

definition.definition: an amount of money that parents regularly give to their child to spend as they choose
to prepare for the possibility of
definition.example: We should make allowance for bad weather and have plenty of umbrellas available.

definition.definition: To make allowances for someone is to think about their characteristics and not judge them too severely
definition.example: You should make allowances for him - he's been quite ill recently.

definition.definition: the amount of something available or needed for a particular purpose
definition.example: What is the recommended daily allowance of vitamin A?

definition.definition: An allowance is also money given by parents to a child every week that the child can spend.
money that someone is given regularly by their employer or by the government to pay for a particular thing
definition.example:
an accommodation/car/mileage allowance
an allowance for sth/to do sth Some companies will even give their telecommuting executives an allowance to buy office furniture for their home.
Employees relocating to London receive a maximum allowance of £1000 a year.

definition.definition: an amount of something that someone is allowed to have, use, produce, etc.
definition.example:
baggage/luggage allowance Baggage allowance is 2 free bags per passenger, and $80 per additional bag.

definition.definition: an amount of goods that you are allowed to buy and take into another country before you have to start paying tax
definition.example: The Australian Customs Service will not charge you duty or tax on goods you bring in if they are within the duty-free allowance guidelines.

definition.definition: an amount of money that can be taken off your income before the tax owed is calculated
definition.example:
a tax allowance
a personal/married couple's/single person's allowance
an annual allowance

definition.definition: an amount of money that can be taken off a company's profits before the tax owed is calculated
definition.example: The purchaser of assets can claim allowances on certain items such as plant and machinery.

definition.definition: the fact of planning or paying now for a possible future change in a situation or a possible future cost, or the amount that is planned for
definition.example:
make an allowance for sth It is unlikely that the regulator will make any allowance for falls in customer service caused by a strike.

definition.definition: a special arrangement, such as a lower price, that manufacturers offer to stores which are going to sell their products
definition.example: When selling a new product, manufacturers sometimes give retailers an allowance, for example a sale or return agreement.

definition.definition: a metal that is made by mixing two or more metals, or a metal and another substance
definition.example:

alloy wheels

definition.definition: to mix a metal with one or more other metals to form a new substance
definition.example:

definition.definition: a metal that is made by mixing together two or more metals, or a metal and another substance
able to be used in many different ways or situations
definition.example: an all-purpose household cleaner

definition.definition: having or including famous actors or players

an all-star baseball team

definition.definition: involving the best players or performers

definition.definition: An all-time high, low, best, etc. is the highest, lowest, best, etc. level that has ever been
definition.example: After three years of drought, the water in the lake had reached an all-time low.

definition.definition: the highest, lowest, best, etc. that something has ever been

definition.definition: to mention someone or something in a brief or indirect way

definition.definition: the quality of being attractive, interesting, or exciting

definition.definition: attraction, charm, or excitement

definition.definition: attractive or exciting

definition.definition: made up of sand and earth left by rivers, floods, etc.

definition.definition: a country that has agreed to give help and support to another, esp. during a war, or a person who helps and supports someone else

definition.example: I refused to ally myself with that mob.

definition.definition: the school, college, or university where you studied

the school, college, or university where you studied, or the official song of a school, college, or university

a book published every year that contains facts and information about a particular subject or activity

a book published every year that contains facts and information, esp. tables showing the days, weeks, and months, important holidays, and times when the sun and moon rise, or a book containing facts and information about a particular subject

definition.definition: (of God) having the power to do everything

definition.definition: very big, loud, or serious

definition.definition: God

definition.definition: having the power to do everything

definition.definition: Almighty also means very strong and powerful

definition.definition: God
definition.example: We asked the Almighty for mercy.

definition.definition: an edible oval nut with a hard shell, or the tree that it grows on

definition.definition: an edible, oval nut with a hard shell, or the tree that it grows on
nearly

She's almost 30.

definition.definition: in the air or in a higher position

definition.definition: without other people

definition.definition: without other people
definition.example:
She decided to climb the mountain alone.

definition.definition: without any others, or only

definition.definition: in a line next to something long
definition.example:

definition.definition: at a particular place on a road, river, etc.

definition.definition: moving forward

definition.definition: in a voice loud enough to be heard

relating to high mountains, esp. the Alps (= the highest mountains in Europe)

an alpine meadow

before the present time

definition.definition: earlier than the time expected, in a short time, or before the present time

Are you planning a summer trip already? It’s only September!

definition.definition: non-standard form of all right
all right

in addition

definition.definition: in addition

to change something, usually slightly, or to cause the characteristics of something to change

definition.definition: to change the size of clothes so that they fit better

definition.definition: polite word for castrate or spay
to change a characteristic, often slightly, or to cause this to happen

definition.definition: the process of changing something

definition.definition: a change in the appearance, character, or structure of something

an alteration to sth Some alterations to our original plans might be necessary.

significant/major alteration The report's recommendations should be adopted without major alteration.

definition.definition: a loud argument or disagreement

definition.definition: a loud argument or disagreement

definition.definition: changed; different

definition.definition: present participle of alter
to change something, usually slightly, or to cause the characteristics of something to change

We've had to alter some of our plans.
Although the cost of making phone calls is going up, the charge for connecting to the internet will not alter.

definition.definition: to make something happen or exist one after the other repeatedly

definition.definition: with first one thing, then another thing, and then the first thing again

a person or thing that can take the place of another

definition.definition: one that can take the place of another

definition.definition: a situation in which one thing repeatedly happens or exists after another

definition.definition: An alternative plan or method is one that you can use if you do not want to use another one

definition.definition: something that is different from something else, especially from what is usual, and offering the possibility of choice

definition.definition: relating to or using logic (= a formal scientific method of examining or thinking about ideas)

definition.definition: the process of calculating how much tax someone must pay, or the amount that must be paid

definition.definition: the process of testing, and making a judgement about , someone's knowledge, ability, skills, etc.

definition.definition: someone whose job is to judge or decide the amount, value, quality, or importance of something

definition.definition: someone, usually an expert, who makes a judgement or decision about a person or situation after considering all the information

definition.definition: someone who calculates the value of a property, so that a decision can be made about the amount of tax that must be paid on it

definition.definition: a person or company that calculates the cost of loss or damage for your insurance

definition.definition: an expert in a subject who advises a court or other official organization

definition.definition: a useful or valuable quality, skill, or person

definition.definition: to understand and remember new information and make it part of your basic knowledge so that you can use it as your own

definition.definition: to absorb food or a substance into the tissue of a living organism
definition.example: In this form vitamins can be easily assimilated by the body.

definition.example:
Here, in the sound [tʃ], the initial dental sound [t] is lost and assimilated to [ʃ].

In their analysis, they find that speakers prefer not to assimilate sibilants or labials.

definition.definition: to take in and make a part of your basic knowledge something learned from others, so that you can use it as your own

definition.definition: People who are or become assimilated in a society become similar to others by learning and using the customs and culture of the new society

definition.definition: to accept something to be true without question or proof
definition.example:

[+ (that)] I assumed (that) you knew each other because you went to the same school.

[+ to infinitive] We can't assume the suspects to be guilty simply because they've decided to remain silent.

definition.definition: to pretend to have a different name or be someone you are not, or to express a feeling falsely

assume an identity During the investigation, two detectives assumed the identities of antiques dealers.

definition.definition: to take or begin to have responsibility or control, sometimes without the right to do so, or to begin to have a characteristic

definition.definition: to pretend to be someone you are not, or to express a feeling falsely

definition.definition: a promise that something is or behaves as expected
definition.example:
People often look to brands as an assurance of quality.
Although the Fund will strive to achieve its goal, there is no assurance that it will.

definition.definition: to tell someone confidently that something is true, especially so that they do not worry
definition.example:
assure sb of sth The unions assured the new owners of the workers' loyalty to the company.
rest assured You can rest assured (= feel confident) that I shall be there as promised.
[+ speech] "Don't worry, your car will be ready tomorrow," the mechanic assured him.
[+ (that)] She assured him (that) the car would be ready the next day.
The prime minister assured the electorate taxes would not be increased after the election.

definition.definition: to cause something to be certain
definition.example: The play's popularity has been assured by the critics' rave reviews.

definition.definition: (of an organization) to promise to pay an amount of money to a person or their family if that person becomes ill, gets injured, or dies, in return for small regular payments
to promise or tell something to someone confidently or firmly, or to cause someone to feel certain by removing doubt
definition.example:
She assured him (that) the check was in the mail.
The governor assured the voters (that) taxes would not be raised.

definition.definition: to cause something to be certain
definition.example: Her future was assured when her performance drew rave reviews from all the critics.

definition.definition: showing skill and confidence
definition.example: an assured performance

definition.definition: certain to be achieved or obtained
definition.example: Now that the financing has been secured, the production of the film is assured.

definition.definition: certain to happen or be achieved
definition.example:
The agreement required South Korea to provide an assured market for American products.
assured income/profit

definition.definition: that is referred to in an assurance agreement
definition.example:
The "sum assured" is normally the amount that will be paid out on a policy when the policy matures, or if you die before the term.
This person will collect the benefit if the life assured (person named in the assurance policy) dies before the policy matures.

definition.definition: used in compound words to refer to products that meet certain quality standards
definition.example:
farm-assured meat
quality-assured processes/standards

definition.definition: a person who is named in an insurance agreement , especially for a type of insurance that will pay them money at the end of an agreed period, or the person who has the right to receive the money when the person named in the insurance agreement dies
confidently
definition.example: After a disappointing first set, Nadal played assuredly and went on to win the match.

definition.definition: certainly
definition.example: These problems might not be solved by money alone, but they will assuredly not be solved without it.

definition.definition: in a way that causes something to be certain
definition.example: These problems might not be solved by money alone, but they will assuredly (= certainly) not be solved without it.

definition.definition: the symbol * , used to refer readers to a note at the bottom of a page of text, or to show that a letter is missing from a word
definition.example: Sometimes taboo words are written with asterisks to avoid causing offence.

definition.definition: something that makes an achievement less impressive or less complete
definition.example: It's a new world record, but one with an asterisk.

definition.definition: to write an asterisk next to something
definition.example: I have asterisked the books that are essential reading for the course.

definition.definition: a symbol (*) shaped like a star
one of many large rocks that circle the sun
an object like a very large rock that goes around the sun like a planet
definition.example: Scientists are hoping an asteroid will clue them in about early life on earth.

definition.definition: a medical condition that makes breathing difficult by causing the air passages to become narrow or blocked
definition.example:
an asthma sufferer
asthma attack Medics tended to a boy who was having an asthma attack.

definition.definition: a chest disease in which breathing can become difficult, often caused by an allergic reaction
a fault in the lens of the eye that reduces the quality of sight, especially a fault that stops the eye from focusing
to surprise someone very much
definition.example:
I was astonished by how much she'd grown.
What astonished me was that he didn't seem to mind.

definition.definition: to surprise someone very much
definition.example:
We were astonished at how much she had aged.
It was astonishing to see the size of the crowds for the Pope.
To the astonishment of her colleagues, she turned down the award.

definition.definition: very surprised
definition.example:
[+ to infinitive] I was astonished to see Miriam there.
They looked astonished when I announced I was pregnant.
The doctors were astonished at the speed of her recovery.

definition.definition: very surprising
definition.example:
Her first novel enjoyed an astonishing success.
[+ to infinitive] It's astonishing to think that only a few years ago he was a completely unknown actor.

definition.definition: in a way that is very surprising
definition.example:
She did astonishingly well in her exams.
Astonishingly, I've never visited the British Museum in all the years I've lived here.

definition.definition: very great surprise
definition.example:
To the astonishment of her colleagues, she resigned.
She gasped in astonishment.

definition.definition: to surprise or shock someone very much
definition.example: The news astounded me.

definition.definition: to surprise and shock someone, esp. with news of something that is completely unexpected
definition.example: Considering how badly they’re paid and what little support they get, the dedication of these teachers astounds me.

definition.definition: very surprised or shocked
definition.example: [+ to infinitive] I was astounded to hear that Tina had left.

definition.definition: very surprising or shocking
definition.example:
an astounding fact/decision/revelation
an astounding (= very great) victory/achievement/success

definition.definition: relating to the stars or outer space
definition.example:
After the 1986 Challenger space shuttle crash, it took some time for the dream of astral travel to be revived.
His belief in astrology commits him to the idea that specific events can be predicted on the basis of astral causation.

definition.definition: relating to a non-physical universe with mysterious forces in it that some people believe to exist
definition.example:
They claimed to be able to conjure spirits from the astral realms.
The stone is said to bring clear psychic vision, and to be excellent for meditation and astral travel.

definition.definition: away from the correct path or correct way of doing something
definition.example:
The letter must have gone astray in the post.
I was led astray by an out-of-date map.
Her parents worried that she might be led astray (= encouraged to behave badly) by her unsuitable friends.

definition.definition: away from the correct path or way of doing something
definition.example: Our district was led astray, and as a result, we wasted valuable resources.

definition.definition: An astringent substance causes the skin or other tissue to tighten
definition.example: an astringent cream

definition.definition: Astringent remarks are clever but unkind or criticize someone
definition.example:
astringent criticism
her astringent wit

definition.definition: having a dry, sour, slightly bitter taste or smell
definition.example:
The astringent taste of the herbs finishes the dish perfectly.
Not everyone likes these astringent berries.

definition.definition: a drug or cream that causes the skin or other tissue to tighten
definition.example: You can use an astringent to make your skin less oily.

definition.definition: a person who has been trained for travelling in space
a person who is trained for traveling in spacecraft
someone who studies astronomy
a person who studies astronomy or whose job is connected with astronomy
connected with astronomy
definition.example:
the Royal Astronomical Society
astronomical observations/instruments

definition.definition: An astronomical amount is extremely large
definition.example: an astronomical rent/bill/price/fee

definition.definition: extremely large
definition.example: The costs were astronomical.

definition.definition: connected with astronomy
definition.example: astronomical observations

definition.definition: the scientific study of the universe and of objects that exist naturally in space, such as the moon, the sun, planets, and stars
the scientific study of the universe as a whole and of objects that exist naturally in space, such as the stars
the type of astronomy that uses physical laws and ideas to explain the behaviour of the stars and other objects in space
able to understand a situation quickly and see how to take advantage of it
definition.example:
an astute investor/businesswoman
his astute handling of the situation
an astute observer of human behaviour

definition.definition: quick to see how to use a situation to your advantage
definition.example: He was politically astute, and was soon appointed to a number of powerful committees in Congress.

definition.definition: into forcefully separated pieces
definition.example: Their lives were torn asunder by the tragedy.

definition.definition: protection or safety, especially that given by a government to people who have been forced to leave their own countries for their safety or because of war
definition.example: to seek/apply for political asylum

definition.definition: a hospital for people with mental illnesses
definition.example: a lunatic asylum

definition.definition: protection or safety, or a protected and safe place, given esp. to someone who has left a country or place for political reasons
definition.example: The refugees have asked for political asylum.

definition.definition: a mental hospital, or any other institution giving shelter and other help to poor or suffering people
definition.example: He was committed to an insane asylum in 1899.

definition.definition: with two halves, sides, or parts that are not exactly the same in shape and size
definition.example:
Lisette came back from New York with a trendy asymmetric haircut.
Some of the rugs have regular geometric designs and others are decorated with asymmetric shapes.
His slightly asymmetrical features make his face more interesting.

definition.definition: involving actions or parts that are not similar or not balanced, especially because one is much bigger or more powerful than the other
definition.example:
He spoke about the asymmetric nature of many of the conflicts in the world today.
Though both sides have responsibilities under the agreement, their relationship is asymmetrical.

definition.definition: An asymmetric distribution (= the number of times each value of a variable is found in a set of data, shown as a graph, chart, etc.) is not balanced, so that there are more values at either the higher or lower end
definition.example: We anticipated this asymmetric score distribution.

definition.definition: having parts on either side or half that do not match or are not the same size or shape
definition.example: The building's asymmetrical silhouette features a single tower on one corner.

definition.definition: An asymmetrical carbon atom is one that is attached to four different atoms or groups of atoms.
the state of two halves, sides, or parts that are not exactly the same in shape or size
definition.example:
The brain scan showed a hemispheric asymmetry.
Physicists are investigating the apparent asymmetry in the amounts of matter and antimatter in the universe.

definition.definition: the condition of not being equal or equally available between two people or groups
definition.example:
power/information asymmetries
Economic asymmetry between the rich and the poor has worsened in recent years.

definition.definition: the quality of having parts on either side or half that do not match or are not the same size or shape
used to show an exact position or particular place
definition.example:
We'll meet you at the entrance.
That bit at the beginning of the film was brilliant.
She's sitting at the table in the corner.
She was standing at the top of the stairs.
The dog came and lay down at (= next to) my feet.
There's someone at the door (= someone is outside and wants to come in).
We spent the afternoon at a football match.
I enjoyed my three years at university.
I called her but she was at lunch (= away, eating her lunch).

definition.definition: used to show an exact or a particular time
definition.example:
There's a meeting at 2.30 this afternoon.
Are you free at lunchtime?
In theory, women can still have children at the age of 50.
The bells ring at regular intervals through the day.
At no time/point did the company do anything illegal.
I'm busy at the moment (= now) - can you call back later?
It's a shame I wasn't here to meet you - I was overseas at the time (= then).

definition.definition: in the direction of
definition.example:
She smiled at me.
They waved at us as we drove by.
She aimed at the target.
"Look at me! Look at me!" called the little girl.
He's always shouting at the children.

definition.definition: used to show the cause of something, especially a feeling
definition.example:
We were surprised at the news.
I was quite excited at the prospect.
Why does no one ever laugh at my jokes?

definition.definition: used to show the activity in which someone's ability is being judged
definition.example:
I was never very good at sports.
He's very good at getting on with people.
She's hopeless at organizing things.

definition.definition: the @ symbol that joins the name of a person or a department in an organization to a domain name to make an email address
definition.example: "What's your email address?" "It's dictionary at cambridge dot org."

definition.definition: used to show a price, temperature, rate, speed, etc.
definition.example:
I'm not going to buy those shoes at $150!
Inflation is running at 5 percent.
He was driving at 120 mph when the police spotted him.

definition.definition: used in financial records to show the price, rate, etc. of a particular thing or of each of a number of things on a list
used to show a state, condition, or continuous activity
definition.example:
a country at war
children at play

definition.definition: used to show a particular place or a particular time
definition.example:
I’ll meet you at the theater at 7:45 tonight.
Call me at work.
There’s someone at the door (= outside the door).
I wasn’t here to meet you because I was in Detroit at the time (= then).

definition.definition: in the direction of
definition.example:
They waved at us as we drove by.
She aimed at the target, but missed.

definition.definition: used to show the cause of something, esp. a feeling
definition.example: I was so happy at the news.

definition.definition: used to show a state, condition, or continuous activity
definition.example:
The country was at peace/war.
I love watching the children at play.
She was hard at work (= working hard).

definition.definition: used to show a price, temperature, rate, speed, etc.
definition.example: They’re selling these coats at 30% off this week.

definition.definition: used to show the activity in which someone’s ability is being judged
definition.example:
I’m really not very good at math.
Sheila is really terrible at getting to places on time.

definition.definition: used before a superlative
definition.example:
I’m afraid we can only pay you $12 an hour at (the) most.
At best you’ll get to speak to some assistant – you’ll never reach anyone important.

definition.definition: not knowing what to do
definition.example:
I’m at a loss to explain what happened.
I was so embarrassed that I was at a loss for words (= I didn’t know what to say).

definition.definition: during any one period
definition.example: I can only do one thing at a time.

definition.definition: (used to make negatives and questions stronger) in any way or of any type
definition.example:
He's had no food at all.
I haven't been at all well recently.
I'm afraid I have nothing at all to say.
Is there any uncertainty at all about the way she died?
Why bother getting up at all when you don't have a job to go to?

definition.definition: (used to make negatives and questions stronger) in any way or of any type
definition.example:
I haven’t been at all well recently.
He’s had no food at all.
I’m not at all worried about it.

definition.definition: If something must be done or avoided at all costs or at any cost, it must be done or avoided whatever happens, even if it is very difficult or causes a lot of problems
definition.example:
Security during the president's visit must be maintained at all costs.
This was a situation we had to avoid at all costs.
Their motivation was victory at any cost.
I don't believe in extending life at any cost.
His proposals are outrageous and should be resisted at all cost.

definition.definition: whatever happens
definition.example: Well, I'm not going home on foot, at any rate.

definition.definition: something you say to show that you are going to say something more exactly
definition.example: I don't think they liked my idea. At any rate, they weren't very enthusiastic about it.

definition.definition: more exactly or clearly
definition.example: I don’t think they liked my idea – at any rate, they weren’t very enthusiastic.

definition.definition: If an animal is at bay, it is about to be caught or attacked.
used in instructions when buying and selling shares to show that you want to buy or sell at the best price possible
definition.example: As prices start to fall, brokers are instructed to sell at best.

definition.definition: when first looking
definition.example:
At first glance I thought it was a dog (but I was mistaken).
At first glance, they make an unlikely couple.
That looks like the house I grew up in, at first glance. But it's certainly bigger than mine, and has a different door now that I look more closely.
He appears, at first glance, like any other little boy running around the park.
At first glance, he could pass for a teenager, but then you look a bit closer.

definition.definition: when first considering something, before having a chance to look at it carefully
definition.example: At first glance the deal looked wonderful, but after reading the fine print he wasn’t so sure.

definition.definition: near in time or position
definition.example: help is at hand We want to ensure that help is at hand (= easily available) for all children suffering abuse.

definition.definition: happening or present at this time
definition.example: The space shuttle crew must stay completely focused on the task at hand.

definition.definition: used to say what someone is really like
definition.example: He had dozens of friends, but he was a private person at heart.

definition.definition: someone who writes for a magazine, newspaper or website and has no particular area of responsibility but can write about any subject that interests them, or suggest subjects for other people to write about
definition.example:
I met the European editor-at-large of American Vogue.
She is editor at large for Tatler.
He took up an editor-at-large role at Fortune magazine, writing an occasional column and contributing many story ideas.

definition.definition: an important editor in some companies that publish books, newspapers, magazines, etc.
definition.example: Joseph Nocera is editor-at-large at Fortune magazine and author of 'A Piece of the Action'.

definition.definition: finally
definition.example:
I've finished my essay at last!
At long last the government is starting to listen to our problems.
At last we arrived at the hotel and were taken to our rooms.
In the countryside she found herself freed at last from the anxiety that had plagued her in the city.
He has agreed, at long last, to give his version of events.

definition.definition: finally, after much waiting
definition.example: At long last the government is starting to listen to our problems.

definition.definition: as much as, or more than, a number or amount
definition.example:
It will cost at least $100.
It will be £200 at the very least.
You'll have to wait at least an hour.

definition.definition: used to reduce the effect of a statement
definition.example: I've met the president - at least, he shook my hand once.

definition.definition: used to emphasize that something is good in a bad situation
definition.example: It's a small house but at least there's a garden.

definition.definition: used to say that someone should do something small, even if they do nothing else
definition.example: Even if she didn't want to send a present, she could at least have sent a card.

definition.definition: used to emphasize that something is good in a bad situation
definition.example: The car was damaged, but at least he wasn’t hurt.

definition.definition: At (the very) least means not less than
definition.example:
It will cost at least $1000.
I’ll be gone for two weeks, at the very least.

definition.definition: At least can also be used to reduce the effect of a statement
definition.example: I can handle it – at least, I think so.

definition.definition: for a long time
definition.example:
George went on at great length about his various illnesses.
He talked at length about his visits to various Roman sites.
The article deals at length with how to evaluate different sources of information.
She'll call her interior designer to discuss at length which lampshade to buy.
I'm a huge jazz fan and can go on about it at some length, given the chance.

definition.definition: If something happens at length, it happens after a long period of time
definition.example:
At length, the authorities allowed her to go home.
At length, the suspect replied.
At length, all the obstacles were overcome and we were able to set off.
He waited anxiously until at length he spotted her entering the room.
At length, the two sides reached an agreement.

definition.definition: finally
definition.example:
I've finished my essay at last!
At long last the government is starting to listen to our problems.
At last we arrived at the hotel and were taken to our rooms.
In the countryside she found herself freed at last from the anxiety that had plagued her in the city.
He has agreed, at long last, to give his version of events.

definition.definition: finally, after much waiting
definition.example: At long last the government is starting to listen to our problems.

definition.definition: used when saying what is the largest possible amount or number
definition.example:
At most, the work will take a week.
It should cost around $20, or $30 at the most.
They weigh a few ounces at most.
She must have been five or six years of age at most.
This costs most companies a few thousand pounds at the most.
Food accounts for 15 percent of their revenue at the very most.

definition.definition: in disagreement
definition.example:
The two brothers were always at odds.
His behavior is clearly at odds with what the college expects from its students.

definition.definition: immediately
definition.example: You have to call him at once .

definition.definition: At once also means at the same time
definition.example: Everything happened at once – she graduated, got a job, and got married, all in June!

definition.definition: at or during any particular point or moment in the day
definition.example:
Only a certain number of people are allowed in the building at any one time.
I'm sorry, but I'm too busy to help you now - I can only do one thing at a time.
We have to ensure that a minimum of 50 officers are guarding the prison's inmates at any one time.
Between Monday and Friday, there are rarely fewer than 150 people answering phones at any given time.
Supermarkets are starting to limit the number of low-cost items that can be purchased at a time.

definition.definition: a gentle way of saying that someone is dead
definition.example: Now she is at peace and her suffering is over.

definition.definition: now
definition.example:
"Are you busy?" "Not at present."
At present she's working abroad.
There is no fighting in the area at present.
At present, the organization has around 5,000 members.
Unfortunately, we cannot see a solution to this problem at present.
There is no access to clean water at present.

definition.definition: by chance, or without being chosen intentionally
definition.example:
The winning entry will be the first correct answer drawn at random.
Participants were selected at random.
Ten more horses from the races were chosen at random for testing.
The first five correct answers picked at random will be the winners.
Vehicles were pulled over seemingly at random.
The answers seemed to be plucked at random.

definition.definition: to (cause someone or something to) stop doing a particular activity or stop being active for a period of time in order to relax and get back your strength
definition.example:
The doctor told him that he should rest for a few days.
He looked away from the computer screen to rest his eyes.
She promised that she would not rest (= would not stop looking) until the murderer of her son was caught and imprisoned.

definition.definition: to be an actor who does not have any work
definition.example: Over 90 percent of professional actors are resting at any given time.

definition.definition: said by lawyers in a law court when they have finished the explanation of their case
to lie or lean on something, or to put something on something else so that its weight is supported
definition.example:
She rested her head on my shoulder.
The bicycle was resting against the wall.

definition.definition: to remain in a particular state or place
definition.example: We cannot allow the matter to rest here (= to remain as it is)- further action has to be taken.

definition.definition: the other things, people, or parts that remain or that have not been mentioned
definition.example:
I've got two bright students, but the rest are average.
I'll keep a third of the money and the rest is for you.
Do you have anything planned for the rest of the day?

definition.definition: a period of time in which you relax, do not do anything active, or sleep
definition.example:
After they had carried the piano up the stairs, they stopped for a rest.
The doctor prescribed some pills and told her to get/have a week's rest.

definition.definition: a period of silence between musical notes, or a symbol that represents this
definition.example: a minim rest

definition.definition: not doing anything active, or not moving
definition.example: Her heartbeat is only 55 at rest.

definition.definition: used as a polite way to say that someone is dead
definition.example: Your father was a very troubled man, but he's at rest now.

definition.definition: to stop, usually in a particular place
definition.example: The car hit the kerb, rolled over and came to rest in a ditch.

definition.definition: an object that supports the weight of something
definition.example: I used a pile of books as a rest for my telescope.

definition.definition: to stop being active for a period of time in order to relax and get back your strength, or to cause someone or something to stop doing an activity in order to get back strength
definition.example:
[I] We hiked for five miles and then rested for a while.
[T] The coach decided to rest some of the team’s starters tomorrow night.
[T] I just need to sit down and rest my legs.

definition.definition: to be or stay under the control of a particular person or organization
definition.example: The final decision rests with the City Council.

definition.definition: to lie or lean on something, or to put something on something else so that its weight is supported
definition.example: [T] She rested her elbows on the table.

definition.definition: a mark in written music that shows when and for how long an instrument should not play
the other things, people, or parts that are left
definition.example: I want to do something else with the rest of my life.

definition.definition: At rest means not doing anything active or not moving
definition.example: The cat seemed coiled to spring, even when it was at rest.

definition.definition: confused
definition.example: I'm all/completely at sea with the new computer system.

definition.definition: confused
definition.example: With no data they could depend on, they were completely at sea.

definition.definition: used when saying what is the largest possible amount or number
definition.example:
At most, the work will take a week.
It should cost around $20, or $30 at the most.
They weigh a few ounces at most.
She must have been five or six years of age at most.
This costs most companies a few thousand pounds at the most.
Food accounts for 15 percent of their revenue at the very most.

definition.definition: used to mention something that must be considered in addition to what you have just said
definition.example: No one likes conflict, but at the same time we have to deal with this problem.

definition.definition: If two things happen at the same time, they happen together
definition.example:
We arrived at the same time.
Maryam and I worked there at the same time.
The symptoms don't always occur at the same time.
All three projects are happening at the same time, so we're busy.
I noticed that they left at the same time.
We all got there at the same time.
Megan and I had our first babies at the same time.

definition.definition: despite what was just said
definition.example: She’s optimistic that she can get results, but at the same time, she knows it’s a very hard job.

definition.definition: sometimes
definition.example:
You can be really annoying at times, you know.
As a colleague, he could be frustrating at times.
She struggled at times to feed and clothe her three children.
I found the plot a little confusing at times.
The stress of the job has been almost overwhelming at times.
At times I felt like giving up, but something made me carry on.
At times he seemed overcome by emotion and almost struggled to speak.

definition.definition: less active or intelligent than you are at other times
definition.example: I'm at my worst first thing in the morning.

definition.definition: showing the most unpleasant side of someone's character
definition.example: This problem over late payment has shown him at his worst.

definition.definition: used to say what the most unpleasant or difficult situation could possibly be
definition.example: At worst, she can only tell you off for being late.

definition.definition: considering someone or something in the most negative or unkind way possible
definition.example: She is at worst corrupt, and at best has been knowingly breaking the rules.

definition.definition: in the worst possible case
definition.example: There’s no harm in applying for the job – at worst, they’ll turn you down.

definition.definition: a feeling or reaction that comes from long ago in human history, rather than being necessary or appropriate in modern times
definition.example:
There is something disconcerting about the seeming atavism of demonstrators carrying torches.
I don't believe the urge to connect with other people is an atavism.

definition.definition: happening because of a very old habit from a long time ago in human history, not because of a conscious decision or because it is necessary now
definition.example: an atavistic fear of the dark

definition.definition: past simple of eat
past simple of eat
a room or building in which an artist works
the fact of not believing in any god or gods, or the belief that no god or gods exist
definition.example:
Atheism as we know it did not exist until modern times.
He uses science to support his own brand of materialistic atheism.

definition.definition: the belief that God does not exist
someone who does not believe in any god or gods, or who believes that no god or gods exist
definition.example:
As an atheist, I do not accept this religious argument.
His father was an atheist.

definition.definition: not believing in any God or gods, or relating to such beliefs
definition.example:
Although I am atheist, I don’t just automatically hate religion or dismiss other people's faith.
Kaufman claims that his atheist beliefs play a central role in his life.

definition.definition: someone who believes that God does not exist

definition.example: atheistic books and articles

definition.definition: someone who does not believe in any god or gods, or who believes that no god or gods exist
definition.example:
As an atheist, I do not accept this religious argument.
His father was an atheist.

definition.definition: not believing in any God or gods, or relating to such beliefs
definition.example:
Although I am atheist, I don’t just automatically hate religion or dismiss other people's faith.
Kaufman claims that his atheist beliefs play a central role in his life.

definition.definition: someone who believes that God does not exist

definition.example: atheistic books and articles

definition.definition: in Greek mythology (= ancient stories), the goddess (= female god) of wisdom who was believed to protect the city of Athens
definition.example: Atop the Acropolis, the temple of the goddess Athena looms over the city.

definition.definition: the capital city of Greece, situated in the southern part of the country
a person who is very good at sports or physical exercise, especially one who competes in organized events
definition.example:
He became a professional athlete at the age of 16.
She has the build of an athlete.

definition.definition: to fasten, join, or connect something

definition.definition: written on an envelope or at the top of a letter to show who should read it

definition.definition: listening carefully

definition.definition: If someone is attentive, they are very helpful and take care of you
definition.example:
attentive to He was very attentive to her when she was ill.
A good teacher is always attentive to their students' needs.

definition.definition: listening or watching carefully
definition.example: an attentive audience

definition.definition: in a way that is attentive (= listening carefully or giving careful attention)
definition.example:
The children sat listening attentively to the story.
These developments are being watched attentively.

definition.definition: to make something less or weaker
definition.example:
Radiation from the sun is attenuated by the earth's atmosphere.

definition.definition: to make something longer and thinner
definition.example: The artist has attenuated the limbs.

definition.definition: to show, say, or prove that something exists or is true

definition.definition: to say officially, for example by signing your name, that a document such as a will (= a document in which a person says what should be done with their money and property after they die) has been written and signed correctly
definition.example:

definition.definition: (of a person) to state with authority that something is true, or (of a situation or event) to show that something is likely to be true
definition.example:
[+ that clause] As one who worked there for years, I can attest that applications are carefully reviewed.

definition.definition: to sign a document to show that you were present when it was signed by someone else
definition.example:

definition.definition: to say officially that something is true or accurate
definition.example:

attest to sth The commission demands that Chief Financial Officers personally attest to the accuracy of their financial statements.

definition.definition: to show that something is true
definition.example: attest to sth The decline in sales attests to the fact that the product is out of date.

definition.definition: the space or room at the top of a building, under the roof, often used for storing things

an attic bedroom at the top of the house

definition.definition: a space in a house just under the roof, often used for storing things

definition.definition: clothes, esp. of a particular type

definition.definition: a feeling or opinion about something or someone, or a way of behaving that is caused by this

definition.definition: slightly aggressive behaviour (= showing willingness to fight or argue), or a failure to show respect that makes someone difficult to deal with
